column4: hey, when i try to log out of ubuntu, to switch users or change window managers, the screen goes black and my mouse cursor freezes. i'm using the proprietary ati drivers (fglrx) and i've got an ati radeon x700. this happens in both gnome and kde.
I had that in dapper. It got better when I upgraded to edgy.
i'm in edgy now
what really solved my graphics problems was installing a PCIe nvidia card.
oh. that really sucks, i'm broke
radeon driver won't work either?

when i first installed ubuntu, i couldn't change screen resolutions properly so i went to get the ati drivers. i chose the closed-source drivers because it seemed like the better choice for my computer
I think you did the right thing, however, the quality of the ATI supplied drivers has been deteriorating lately
there is a chance that it will pick up as ATI has been acquired by AMD, but the direction is uncertain at the moment.
so is there anything i can do in the meantime? i can't logout or change my window manager without having to completely reboot.
I don't know a solution, but I would try and reinstall fglrx, starting from as clean a slate as possible.
is X700 a shared memory thingy?
how do i check?
let me ask something else first: is it chipset graphics, or is it a separate graphics card in a slot?
i'm really sorry, i don't know much about computer hardware. if you could describe to me how to check, i will, but i am woefully ignorant of anything to do with hardware :P
is your monitor cable attached in the direct vicinity of the keyboard, USB and network sockets on the back of your box? Or is it a couple of inches away from that panel?
lol, gotta turn on some lights :D hold on, i'll check
separate graphics card in a slot, i'd imagine. the monitor cable is separate from everything else.
just found this: http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=150854
ooooh!
that looks great, i'll boot into linux and try it right quick
thanks for the help, and i'll be back if it doesn't work :P
